1 2023 EIDM-AARMS Summer School Two courses are offered for math graduate credit: Mathematical Epidemiology (Math Epi), and Data, models, and decision support. It is intended that participants will take both courses. 30 hours of instruction is considered to be equivalent to a grad course. A pre-requisite problem set will be assigned. Covers preliminaries in dynamical systems, epidemiology, and modelling. Students will work in groups of 2-3 to complete a project. Ideas for project descriptions will be provided. Specific expertise of the instructors includes spatial epidemiology, importations, within-host models, zoonotic spillover, and COVID-19. 7 hours of work is planned each day, expected to occur between 8.30am and 5.30pm with exact times to be determined. 3 Parts You can add parts to organize one or more book chapters together. Parts can be inserted at the top of an .Rmd file, before the first-level chapter heading in that same file. Add a numbered part: # (PART) Act one {-} (followed by # A chapter) Add an unnumbered part: # (PART\*) Act one {-} (followed by # A chapter) Add an appendix as a special kind of un-numbered part: # (APPENDIX) Other stuff {-} (followed by # A chapter). Chapters in an appendix are prepended with letters instead of numbers.
